clinical_study.brief_title: Changes in Cerebral Oxygenation and Cognitive Functions
clinical_study.official_title: Changes in Cerebral Oxygenation and Cognitive Functions During Controlled Hypotension

brief_summary.textblock: The present study aimed to assess the influence of nitroglycerin and esmolol-induced hypotension on cerebral oxygen saturation by using near-infrared spectroscopy and postoperative cognitive function in patients undergoing nasal surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: effects of controlled hypotension on cerebral oxygen saturation
primary_outcome.time_frame: until end of the surgical procedure.
primary_outcome.description: influence of nitroglycerin and esmolol-induced hypotension on cerebral oxygen saturation by measuring regional cerebral oxygen saturation using Near-Infrared Spectroscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: effects of controlled hypotension on cognitive function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hour before surgery and 24 hour after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: influence of nitroglycerin and esmolol-induced hypotension on postoperative cognitive function using mini mental test score

study_pop.textblock: - required controlled hypotension scheduled for nasal surgeries

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- written informed consent
- patients with ASA physical status of I-II
- aged 18-65 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age under 18 or above 65
- ASA > II
- coagulation disorders
- history of cardiovascular and cerebrovascular disease
- poor Blood Pressure control
- anemia, pregnancy, addiction to opioids
- body mass index (BMI) > 35
- intraoperative systolic BP < 65 mmHg
- surgical duration less than 30 minutes or more than 160 minutes
- need for an intraoperative sympathomimetic drug and the use of other hypotensive drugs
- preoperative Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score of 23 or less.
